byline.contributor: Palko Karasz reported from Nickelsdorf, and Barbara Surk from Ljubljana, Slovenia. Reporting was contributed by Emmarie Huetteman from Salzburg, Austria; Bostjan Videmsek from Celje, Slovenia; Sewell Chan from London; Somini Sengupta from the United Nations; Peter Baker from Washington; and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By PALKO KARASZ and BARBARA SURK

abstract: Austria assumes lead in efforts to process migrants from Middle East, as quarreling Eastern European countries tighten their borders, and rest of continent falters in addressing crisis; refugees are elated by Austria's acceptance in contrast to other less welcoming environments.
lead_paragraph: Since the start of the weekend, about 27,000 migrants have entered reception centers and camps where they have received food, housing and health care before they move on to Germany.

headline.main: Austria Takes Role of Distribution Center for Germany-Bound Migrants
headline.print_headline: Austria Takes Role of Distribution Center for Germany-Bound Migrants

snippet: Since the start of the weekend, about 27,000 migrants have entered reception centers and camps where they have received food, housing and health care before they move on to Germany.
